And that changed the whole dynamics of the NFL..passing yards went up..etc etc. Then the Pats trick play against the Ravens..which were within the rules for crying out loud!! But because the Pats were so smart and clever..and that type of play wasnt done before..the ravens crying like babies wanting the rule changed...Now what did the NFL do? changed the rule. Goodell is nothing more than a controlled puppet...smh..waste..and who was the lead guy heading this witchhunt? Mike Kensil.......QUOTE...." Mike Kensil, the real man behind the Deflate-Gate curtain. Kensil, who is currently the NFL‚Äôs VP of game operations, was with the New York Jets‚Äô front office until 2006. His tenure with the team included Belichick abandoning the Jets in 2000 to build a dynasty in Foxborough, and Kensil has been butthurt ever since. So‚Ä¶ the man who is the driving force behind the supposedly impartial investigation against the Patriots has had a personal, public vendetta against the team for the past 15 years.  AND he lied and said that the recorded PSI levels of the Patriots‚Äô balls were so low that like the weather couldn‚Äôt possibly have been the cause of deflation. Seems kosher.

This latest revelation perfectly illustrates how this whole investigation isn‚Äôt about discovering the truth, but instead smearing the most successful franchise of the 21st century. The Patriots might not be the nicest bunch, but, at the end of the day, they‚Äôre definitely big-time winners, and people hate them for the tremendous success they‚Äôve achieved. Deflate-Gate, as Dave Skylark would put it, is nothing more than an ugly manifestation of all that peanut butter and jealousy against New England, and hopefully, the NFL gets wise and lays off the slander before this whole thing totally explodes in their face."

http://www.foxsports.com/nfl/story/aaron-rodgers-green-bay-packers-tom-brady-new-england-patriots-deflated-footballs-012015 Goodell..what about Rodgers "pushing the limit" with how hard he can over inflate the football?..............QUOTE....."Tom Curran of CSNNE.com did some digging after the New England Patriots were accused of using somewhat deflated footballs in their AFC championship game romp over the Indianapolis Colts on Sunday.
Curran reported on a clip from the Packers-Patriots game on Nov. 30, where CBS announcers Jim Nantz and Phil Simms discussed how Rodgers wanted the football he used to feel.
"(Rodgers) said something [that] was unique," Simms revealed. "[Rodgers said] 'I like to push the limit to how much air we can put in the football, even go over what they allow you to do and see if the officials take air out of it.' Because he thinks it's easier for him to grip. He likes them tight."
As Curran astutely points, out, "Ball manipulation could be an NFL epidemic."

Let me be clear that I support and stand by the innocence of Tom Brady and The New England Patriots organization 100%.  Whether others disagree is irrelevant.  We are all entitled to our opinions.

This decision is unfortunate and more importantly unfounded for Tom Brady and The Patriots.  

Tom Brady is still the Best Quarterback of all time who is playing for the Best Coach and Team of all time.  Neither The NFL or Roger Goodell can change that fact.

With that being said, I will not watch ANY NFL games this coming season if Tom doesn't start...which will be the first time since I started following Tom's career in 2001. 

Tom, Mr. Belichek,  Mr. Kraft,  and The New England Patriots remember this:  

Those who are average will never be able to come up to your level.  They will only be able to bask in the small  victories disguised as obstacles that they try to place in your way.  

Be mindful of their actions, but stay positive and focused on obtaining your future goals.  For those who partake in envy will always be just that...average.

Sincerely, 
Katrina Silverstein

But if I was a Bronco, Jet or Colt fan I would still be incensed. Goodell is the fair and just arbitrator of the suspension and he‚Äôs getting pressure from his bosses. They want to protect the integrity of the game by pressuring the decision maker to disregard the facts, whatever they are. This is protecting the integrity of the game? Don‚Äôt they understand the irony of it? This is just and fair?Let‚Äôs hit the NFL in the pocketbook. The NFL owns the NFL channel. If you watch the channel stop watching it until Brady s suspension is lifted. The data in Wells Report conclusively exonerates Patriots!

Bottom Line: THE PRESSURE VALUES OF THE COLTS‚Äô BALLS MEASURED AT HALF TIME ARE IN VIOLATION OF WHAT THE IDEAL GAS LAW SAYS THEY SHOULD HAVE BEEN (as calculated by Wells‚Äôs own tech team!). THE COLTS BALL PRESSURES ARE TOO HIGH (see table and explanation below)!

The Wells team used one thing to implicate the Patriots: the difference in average pressure drop from before the game, to half time, between the two teams‚Äô balls. Unfortunately, they focused on only one of the possibilities for why there could have been a difference. They incorrectly jumped to the conclusion that the ‚Äòproblem‚Äô was with the Patriots‚Äô balls being too low in pressure. They did not even consider the possibility that the Colts‚Äô balls could have been too HIGH! In fact, that is what really happened! 

Here are the two key things that the Wells Report missed; evidence that proves the Pats‚Äô innocence:
1. The reduction in pressures of the Pats‚Äô balls is completely consistent with what was predicted to have happened via the ideal gas law, as calculated by Exponent (the independent company that did the technical analysis for the Wells report). In other words, the deflation of the Pats‚Äô balls can be explained ENTIRELY through physics/thermodynamics with the Wells Team‚Äôs own analyses. I have no idea how this was missed in all of this sordid mess!
2. There was a botched measurement of the half time pressures of the Colts‚Äô balls ‚Äì the referees were likely focused so much on measuring the Pats‚Äô balls that they waited too long to measure the Colts‚Äô balls. By that time, the Colts‚Äô balls had warmed up enough in the locker room to increase in pressure. That is the real reason why there was a difference in pressure drop between the two teams‚Äô balls. Unless the locker room where the Colts‚Äô balls originally came from that day was colder than 60degF (which makes no sense), the measured pressure drop experienced by their balls violates the ideal gas law (see below for details)!

This PROVES the Pats and Brady were telling the truth the whole time; they are innocent of ANY wrongdoing.

Brady is in a class all by himself.  His performance statistics give him immediate first ballot induction into The Pro Football Hall of Fame.
  However, there is still the lingering question of how "Deflate Gate" will haunt him, to which, one Sports Illustrated Writer wrote an article called, "Hall of Fame Voters on If Deflategate Will Impact Their Vote For Brady".
  7 out of 8 say no.  Deflate Gate does not sway their opinion on Tom Brady being immortalized.  
  Well, what about Spy Gate?
  Every one I ask says it had nothing to do with Brady and it was just one game.
  Really? One Game?!  The one against the Jets that got them caught.  The one that caused them to have to pay team and personal fines, because The League became aware long before The Jets game and told The Patriots to stop.  However, they  felt they were above the league and they would only get a slap on the wrist when they got caught.  Which, that is what happened.
  However, Senator Arlen Specter of Pa. Was about to launch a Senatorial Judiciary Investigation, of which he had the House support.  Then Goodell met with Specter, answered his questions honestly, told Specter, Belichick had been recording opposing teams walk through's for 8 years.  The tapes were destroyed and there is no evidence.  Specter left it at that.
  Wow!  So, the greatest quarter back ever built his first 8 seasons off of receiving stolen information.  Hines Ward attest to evidence of being cheated in this link:   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wnKM4feYpt8
  James Harris said on the opposite side of the ball, The Patriot Defense picked up on 90% of the Pittsburgh Blitz schemes.
  There was a 2004 unapproved ball incident in a match between The Patriots and Miami Dolphins.
  2004?  That was during the 8 years of spying.  So, The Patriots were mixing it up.  Trying to do everything they could to win.
  You know what having a winning record gets a team?  Better players want to play for the better team.  Look at what is currently happening with Lebron James.  He is not resigning with The Cleveland Cavaliers.  He wants to play with better players.  He all but said that in all of his crying.
  Brady is an illusion.  His record says "Hall of Fame".  His antics and the teams pension for cheating say, "How do we know Brady is that good?'  8+ years of cheating?  
  J
